metadata.title: The mechanical effect of aligner’s thickness and material properties in invisible orthodontics: A quantitative finite element study Waheed AHMAD1,2, Jing XIONG3 and Zeyang XIA4 Soft Robotics Research Center, Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shenzhen 518055, China

introduction.heading: Introduction
introduction.first_sentence: Invisible orthodontics, particularly aligners, have attracted considerable attention in recent years, owing largely to their aesthetic qualities and perceived comfort.
introduction.first_100_chars: Invisible orthodontics, particularly aligners, have attracted considerable attention in recent years
introduction.last_sentence: We hypothesized that precise adjustments in either the E or the thickness of aligners could achieve comparable effects on the force and moment exerted, offering potential for tailored therapeutic outcomes.
introduction.last_100_chars: rable effects on the force and moment exerted, offering potential for tailored therapeutic outcomes.

materials_and_methods.heading: Materials and Methods
materials_and_methods.first_sentence: To evaluate the mechanical impact of aligner thickness and material properties on orthodontic treatments, a FE model of the mandibular teeth, periodontal ligament, and bone complex (TPBC) was developed.
materials_and_methods.first_100_chars: To evaluate the mechanical impact of aligner thickness and material properties on orthodontic treatm
materials_and_methods.last_sentence: A total of 432 trials were conducted on each volunteer’s models (nine aligners with different thicknesses×12 sets of E×four teeth explained in Table 2).
materials_and_methods.last_100_chars: er’s models (nine aligners with different thicknesses×12 sets of E×four teeth explained in Table 2).

results.first_sentence: Relation of force and moment with E and thickness of aligner An observable alteration in force and moment generation occurred upon initial tooth movement as the E and thickness of the aligner was adjusted (refer to Figs.

discussion.last_sentence: Additionally, time-dependent properties such as flexure and effective modulus will be integrated to improve model precision and provide a deeper understanding of the biomechanical behavior of aligners in varying clinical conditions.

conclusion.heading: Conclusion
conclusion.first_sentence: Our study quantitatively demonstrates how aligner thickness and Young’s modulus (E) impact orthodontic forces and moments, revealing that variations in these properties can significantly influence tooth movement dynamics.
conclusion.first_100_chars: Our study quantitatively demonstrates how aligner thickness and Young’s modulus (E) impact orthodont
conclusion.last_sentence: This research contributes new insights into the biomechanical effects of aligner adjustments, enhancing our understanding of how material properties can be optimized to improve clinical practices in invisible orthodontics.
conclusion.last_100_chars: of how material properties can be optimized to improve clinical practices in invisible orthodontics.
